description: From Middle English childisch, from Old English ċildisċ. Equivalent to child +‎ -ish.

adjectives.description: childish (comparative more childish, superlative most childish)

entries.meaning: Of or suitable for a child.
examples: She remembered, too, when, after a long childish illness, her father had carried her in his arms to the garden,  […]
Your childish temper tantrums are not going to change my decision on this matter.
